nodes.bodyText: As stated previously in another PR, line changes should only be done for things relevant to the theme of the PR.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -561,11 +562,15 @@ "\tset the cost of enchant offer 1 to 10 levels") .since("2.5"); Skript.registerEvent("Enchant", SimpleEvent.class, EnchantItemEvent.class, "[item] enchant") - .description("Called when a player successfully enchants an item.", - " To get the enchanted item, see the enchant item expression") - .examples("on enchant:", - "\tif the clicked button is enchantment option 1:", - "\t\tset the applied enchantments to sharpness 10 and unbreaking 10") - .since("2.5"); + .description("Called when a player successfully enchants an item.", + " To get the enchanted item, see the enchant item expression") + .examples("on enchant:", + "\tif the clicked button is enchantment option 1:", + "\t\tset the applied enchantments to sharpness 10 and unbreaking 10") + .since("2.5");

nodes.bodyText: Wouldn't there be issues with that?
When making line breaks, Java standards require two indentations not a single indentation. You can look at the other events.
nodes.diffHunk:
